summary:
East Germany, officially the German Democratic Republic (GDR), was a country in Central Europe from 1949 to 1990. It was formed after World War II under Soviet influence and was considered a communist state. The country's economy was controlled by the government, and it was the most successful in the Eastern Bloc. East Germany bordered the Baltic Sea, Poland, Czechoslovakia, and West Germany.

In 1989, protests and social changes led to the fall of the Berlin Wall, and East Germany held its first free election. It then joined West Germany, becoming part of a unified Germany in 1990.
title: East Germany
